column3: @MarcoFalke @practicalswift could you merge this pr now.
> could you merge this pr now\n\nThis is not how contributing works here. Please refer to our docs

"If you have problems with squashing or other git workflows, you can enable "Allow edits from maintainers" in the right-hand sidebar of the GitHub web interface and ask for help in the pull request." - (Sentence in the contribution docs)\n\n@practicalswift I think u can "squash and merge" as I have allowed edits by maintainers.

In future, don't open multiple PRs (#20224) for the same change. If you'd like to contribute to this project you'll need to learn how to use git. That includes how to squash, rebase, edit commits messages etc.
```suggestion\nThe [CI system](/ci) defines build configs for Windows, Linux, and macOS, unit/sanity tests are part of the CI configs.\n```
